title: Sampling Distribution of a Sample Mean: Roll That Dice
question_text:
The roll of a six-sided die has a uniform distribution with a mean outcome of $3.5$ and a standard deviation of approximately $1.708$.
Which of the following best describes the sampling distribution of the sample means when the same dice is rolled $48$ times?

choices.text: Uniform with a ${ \mu }_{ \overline { x } }=3.5$ and a $ \sigma _{ \overline { x } }=1.708$
Uniform with a ${ \mu }_{ \overline { x } }=3.5$ and a $ \sigma _{ \overline { x } }=\dfrac { 1.708 }{ \sqrt { 48 } } $
Normal with a ${ \mu }_{ \overline { x } }=3.5$ and a $\sigma _{ \overline { x } }=\dfrac { 1.708 }{ \sqrt { 48 } } $
Approximately normal with a ${ \mu }_{ \overline { x } }=3.5$ and a $ \sigma _{ \overline { x } }=1.708$
Approximately normal with a ${ \mu }_{ \overline { x } }=3.5$ and a $ \sigma _{ \overline { x } }=\dfrac { 1.708 }{ \sqrt { 48 } } $
